short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Shows a warning banner on the top of the browser when a Substack article has a paywall

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Tired of getting a few thousand words into a Substack post only to realize that it has a paywall? Well, then you need the Substack Paywall Warning plugin, a plugin commissioned by Paul Crowley to make sure no other human ever has to experience that frustration again. It adds a dismissible banner that slides in from the top of the page when loading a Substack.com post or self-hosted Substack page that has a paywall. 

There are no settings, just install it and check a post with a paywall and you will see a banner on the top of your browser that can be dismissed on click. 

*Not in any way affiliated with, endorsed by, or sponsored by Substack Inc. All trademarks, service marks, trade names, referenced herein belong to their respective owners. Their use here is for identification purposes only and does not imply ownership by us or endorsement by them.
